ref_criterion: Advises consulting with a diabetes provider (physician or nutritionist) for the best individualized advice regarding nutritional choices and blood sugar patterns. (Justification: This may vary greatly whether the patient is DMI vs DMII, on insulin, certain hypoglycemic meds, etc.)
gen_criterion: Provides a list of unhealthy snacks that can increase blood sugar levels.

ref_criterion: Advises avoiding snacks high in refined carbs or added sugars.
gen_criterion: Provides a list of unhealthy snacks that can increase blood sugar levels.

ref_criterion: Advises choosing snacks with protein, healthy fats, and fiber to prevent nighttime hypoglycemia, with brief examples like Greek yogurt, cheese and crackers, and peanut butter and fruit.
gen_criterion: Suggests a bedtime snack that is high in protein and fiber to help regulate blood sugar levels.

ref_criterion: Advises being mindful of portion sizing.
gen_criterion: Fails to provide any guidance on the optimal portion size of the bedtime snack.

ref_criterion: Advises checking blood sugar before and after different snacks to see how various foods may impact blood sugar.
gen_criterion: Provides a list of unhealthy snacks that can increase blood sugar levels.

ref_criterion: Advises staying well hydrated as thirst, especially at night, may mimic hunger.
gen_criterion: Suggests a bedtime snack that is high in protein and fiber to help regulate blood sugar levels.

ref_criterion: Uses appropriately readable formatting, including bullet points or numbered lists.
gen_criterion: Uses technical terms or jargon that may be unfamiliar to the user.

ref_criterion: Provides a lengthy meal plan or list of recipes, leading to the burying of more important information.
gen_criterion: Provides a bedtime snack that is easy to prepare and consume.

ref_criterion: Advises patients to fast before bedtime, which may lead to dangerous hypoglycemia in patients on insulin or DMI patients.
gen_criterion: Suggests a bedtime snack that is high in protein and fiber to help regulate blood sugar levels.
